The first gasoline-powered automobile was invented by Karl Benz in 1886. Benz's three-wheeled vehicle was the first to be powered by an internal combustion engine. The first electric automobile was invented by Morrison Electric in 1890. Morrison's vehicle was the first to be powered by an electric motor. The first automobile to be mass-produced was the Ford Model T, which was introduced in 1908. The Model T was powered by a gasoline engine and was the first automobile to be produced on an assembly line. The Model T was a huge success and revolutionized the automobile industry. The first automobile to be powered by a diesel engine was the Mercedes-Benz 260D, which was introduced in 1936. The Mercedes-Benz 260D was a diesel-powered version of the Mercedes-Benz 260, which was a gasoline-powered automobile.
